reviews.author: Brian Woodring
reviews.text:
Such a unique experience they've got set up here! From the super fast elevator, unique facts about the construction of Hudson yard to the glass floor looking down over 100 floors to the city streets.
We got some great pictures od the sunset and some silly photos of us so far up. Solid date night idea. Have a drink and chat with some great scenery.

reviews.author: Jesus E Cruz
reviews.text:
Visiting Edge at Hudson Yards was truly unforgettable. From the moment I stepped onto the sky deck, I was blown away by the panoramic views of New York City. You can see everything ‚Äî the Empire State Building, Central Park, the Statue of Liberty, and the Hudson River ‚Äî all from one place.

The design of the deck is modern and sleek, with angled glass walls and even a glass floor section that adds an exciting thrill. It‚Äôs perfect for taking amazing photos, especially during sunset when the skyline lights up with color.

The entire experience felt well-organized and safe. Staff were friendly, and the champagne bar added a touch of elegance. Whether you're a tourist or a local, I highly recommend making time for Edge. It's one of the best ways to see the city from above

reviews.author: Zane Patterson
reviews.text: Great experience and wonderful views where you can clearly see all of Manhattan. It was sunny out so wear sunscreen and bring sunglasses. Glass floor was fun to walk on, if you‚Äôre into that sort of thing! Prices around $50 per person (depends on ticket type purchased) & I used the kiosk near the Vessel so just picked a time available. When I walked upstairs there was no wait, walked right in and up the elevator. Overall, wonderful experience and a great way to spend about 1-2 hours (or less, but get your money worth üòâ)

reviews.author: Bobby Dawkins
reviews.text: Wife wanted to go for her birthday. The VIP sunset experience is worth every penny. Our host Naomi was very courteous and politely forwarded us past the lines to the elevator. Be sure to arrive as early as you can do you can get a spot at the corner of the glass. It gets crowded and stays crowded quickly. I think they should have a VIP section to complete the experience. Glass floor was cool as was the lower level with ping pong tables and other views not accessible outside. Music inside and outside was great. DJ wasn't playing anything aggressive and was spinning some great club music. No selfie sticks allowed. We will be doing this again next year likely as well as The Vessel next to it.

reviews.author: vanessa correa
reviews.text:
One of the most unforgettable views in New York! I visited The Edge on a warm summer day and discovered a great insider tip: instead of paying for the regular observation deck ticket, I went straight to the bar upstairs. That way, I skipped the entrance fee‚Äîbut yes, you must order something to stay.

Totally worth it! I had a refreshing cocktail with stunning panoramic views of Manhattan, Hudson Yards, and beyond. The vibe was chic but relaxed, and there were fewer crowds than I expected around midday. The glass floor and angled windows give you that adrenaline rush without the line.
If you want the experience without paying the full ticket, head to the bar, enjoy a drink, and soak in the views.

Highly recommended for travelers who want the view and a cocktail to go with it!

name: Washington Square Fountain
address: Washington Square N, New York, NY 10012

reviews.author: John Hoffman
reviews.text: Perfect.... fountain kinda dry, but chilled place to relax

reviews.author: Grace Lee
reviews.text: Love and very much enjoyed people out and about doing different things.

reviews.author: Elyssa Ymb
reviews.text:
Aside from the fact that it was so surreal to actually see it in person because I‚Äôve seen it on a lot of movies/series, there is something so inviting about this park. It‚Äôs in the middle of the city, just a few steps and you‚Äôre already looking at NYU.

This was January 2019. You can see a diversity of people just chilling and having fun. Kids playing and running, this man is making ginormous bubbles, the other guy is playing piano, other people are reading, bonding with their family... WSP sure had witnessed a lot. UGHH.üíï

reviews.author: Gracie grace
reviews.text: Pretty cool spot for a picnic or just a stroll on a beautiful day. Lots of locals doing yoga playing music just hanging out. Eem like It's a no drama  environment;)

reviews.author: Jess Freitas Cordeiro
reviews.text: A lovely little park right by Grenwich Village. Well maintained with beautiful gardens, chessboards, a fountain, and an iconic arch. It's great for people watching, street performances and relaxing.

name: Tiffany Street Clock
address: 200 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010

reviews.author: NY_78Hz
reviews.text: Beautiful old Tiffany and Co. gold clock near the Flatiron building - easy to miss so make sure you look up and take a look. The staff in Tiffany stores will tell you about it too, as well the other famous clock they have in NYC (the first public clock in the city in fact)

reviews.author: Troy Pitcher
reviews.text: Beautiful iconic clock. Check it out when visiting the Flat Iron Building. Wouldn‚Äôt go just to see this.

reviews.author: Monica S
reviews.text: A beautiful Tiffany & Co. clock right by the Flatiron building.

reviews.author: Penis Sukr
reviews.text: Cool looking clock, bad name >:(

reviews.author: SWAT TEAM
reviews.text: Nice clock with the flatiron behind

name: Staple Street Skybridge
address: 9 Jay St, New York, NY 10013

reviews.author: Garrett Nuttall
reviews.text: I come here daily to take photos and to take a break from work. A great neighborhood in NYC,it is safe and clean. Chambers street subway station is a few blocks away.

reviews.author: Matthew
reviews.text:
The Staple Street Bridge is a truly remarkable structure with a fascinating history. Originally part of a hospital, the bridge was used to transport patients between buildings, adding a unique and functional aspect to its design.

The history of the bridge adds to its allure, as it provides a glimpse into the past and how architectural elements were creatively used for practical purposes. Today, the bridge stands as a reminder of its past while also serving as a picturesque landmark in the heart of New York City.

The location of the Staple Street Bridge is indeed stunning. Nestled among the bustling streets of Manhattan, the bridge offers a peaceful retreat, surrounded by historic buildings and charming cobblestone streets.

Visiting the Staple Street Bridge is a must for anyone interested in history, architecture, or simply looking to explore a hidden gem in the city. Its unique design and rich history make it a truly special destination in New York City.

reviews.author: Justa Girl
reviews.text: Lovely Sunday spring walk and route in Tribeca.

reviews.author: Anni K
reviews.text: Located in Tribeca neighborhood and considered one of the ‚Äú must‚Äù photo ops spots in the city. Staple street is one of the shortest streets in the city only spanning across the 2 blocks so it is very easy to over look that location. Skybridge, that at one time connected 2 parts of the hospital, is great background for fun photo shoots. At the moment there‚Äôs construction going but you can still enjoy the architecture and get great pictures.

reviews.author: Maria Eugenia
reviews.text:
The Staple Street Skybridge is one of the most iconic landmarks of New York City ! located in the lovely neighborhood of Tribeca, It was built in 1907 to connect two buildings
This peaceful and charming location is the perfect place to take a break from the noise of the city and a must visit for photographers üì∏

name: Berlin Wall
address: 393 S End Ave, New York, NY 10280

reviews.author: Charles Mooney
reviews.text: A little hard to find, and construction near it/around it made it kind of off-putting but such a cool sight to see. I have been to Berlin and seen sections of the wall - to see a section here in America was surreal and unique. I just wish it had better maintenance and was displayed more adequately.

reviews.author: Luca
reviews.text: A piece of the europen history located in the USA. Nice, also to take 5 minutes to think about what the human race can do.

reviews.author: rhys hugo
reviews.text: Situated across the road from the 9/11 memorial and the One World Trade Centre. It is in a quiet area and not many people know it is a piece of the Berlin wall, so there is plenty of space to take photographs and to pose in photographs.

reviews.author: Jason Braun
reviews.text:
You stroll down to Battery Park City, the Hudson at your back, and there it is, a twelve foot chunk of the Berlin Wall standing in Kowsky Plaza like a scar turned statue. This ripped off fragment once loomed over East Berlin, between Potsdamer Platz and Leipziger Platz, a grim barricade to keep people penned in. Now it is a 2.75 ton slab of defiance turned public art, quietly coughing out freedom lessons while bankers eat their lunches nearby.

This is not a tourist trap with a selfie stick line. It is just a slab of cold war history, painted by Thierry Noir, one of the first to slap color onto oppression, and installed in 2004 as a gift from the German Consulate, marking the fifteenth anniversary of the Wall coming down. You can touch the steel reinforced concrete that once told people to stay in line. It is humbling, absurd, and gorgeous. You stroll down to Battery Park City, the Hudson at your back, and there it is, a twelve foot chunk of the Berlin Wall standing in Kowsky Plaza like a scar turned statue. This ripped off fragment once loomed over East Berlin, between Potsdamer Platz and Leipziger Platz, a grim barricade to keep people penned in. Now it is a 2.75 ton slab of defiance turned public art, quietly coughing out freedom lessons while bankers eat their lunches nearby.

This is not a tourist trap with a selfie stick line. It is just a slab of cold war history, painted by Thierry Noir, one of the first to slap color onto oppression, and installed in 2004 as a gift from the German Consulate, marking the fifteenth anniversary of the Wall coming down. You can touch the steel reinforced concrete that once told people to stay in line. It is humbling, absurd, and gorgeous.

You leave wondering how something that once tore a city in half can now sit in the sun while kids play tag around it. The concrete is still ugly and the story still hurts, but here it stands, a souvenir of when the world was split in two and the line between life and death was poured in cement.

reviews.author: Johnny Appleseedz
reviews.text: I served in Berlin from 1990 to 1994 and had much higher expectation for this tribute.  A single slab of wall and it's missing the smoothed rounded crown at the top of the wall.  I believe this section was called "Chickenlips."  Could have been better.  At least 3 sections with all components to the wall.  If you are going to do it, do it right!!  For anyone who may visit Berlin, do not miss the 1.2km stretch of Berlin Wall at the East Side Gallery.

name: Seaport District
address: 28-20 Fulton St, New York, NY 10038

reviews.author: Chantha Thach
reviews.text: The seaport is such a beautiful place with so see and eat ! There is always some kind of event or art installation going on ! It‚Äôs a weekly visit for me!

reviews.author: THE EXPLORER
reviews.text: We take the bus down to the South Street Seaport several times a year. Mostly during the warm months so we can sit outside the Tin Building overlooking the water and old ships. It is a charming look into old NY history.  Also a good place to eat and people watch.  We always have fun down there.

reviews.author: A R
reviews.text: This is a really cool, historical area of the city with a high-end movie theater that we've visited on one occasion, lots of shops, and lots of restaurants all around. The Seaport is a great area to visit during a nice summer day!

reviews.author: Brenda Deckman
reviews.text: I never got the tree part unless it is referring to a Christmas tree that is put up seasonally. There are a couple of old sailing ships and the Tin Building had some restaurants, but I did not eat there. Just was passing through the area.

reviews.author: Chris Woe
reviews.text: Great place to visit.

name: Rueda de la fortuna
address: 1578 Broadway, New York, NY 10036

reviews.author: Efra And
reviews.text: Nice.

reviews.author: Alsacia Ramos
reviews.text:
I've seen them all.
Wonderful, thank you for all your good wishes for me. May God always take care of you. ‚ôæÔ∏è

reviews.author: Otilia Leal
reviews.text:
Excellent place, the glamour is felt by all races together
Without distinction except for language üòú

reviews.author: Paola Gonzales
reviews.text: Coming to visit tourist places is an extraordinary emotion.

name: Catacombs by Candlelight
address: 266 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012

reviews.author: Melissa Naja
reviews.text:
Wonderful tour with knowledgeable guide for historical Church in New York City. I actually live in NYC and pass by this beautiful Church for many time when I chill out in Soho. When I found out this place is only catacombs in NYC, I decided to book a tour. I learn so much of history of St. Patrick church that this church is the original before they built St. Patrick 's Cathedral on 5th Ave. I was amazing knowing the history of catholic in New York and mystery behind.

The underground was great, some people might say it was short time but maybe because I took a tour at the last round so I feel I spend amount of time down there with no rush. Even it only one level underground but the tomb is deeper than that but with the security and lots of reason they completely seal the tomb so no air in and out of the tomb and no one tough inside for centuries.

reviews.author: A C
reviews.text: Wonderful tour of the cemetery and catacombs of St Patrick Old Cathedral.   While most people would find it   a bit boring as the catacombs are pretty much updated, but the history is what you are going for!  The tour guide was so informative (forgot his name but he was originally from Brooklyn).   If you are lover of history and the origins of catholics in NYC this is the tour for you.    Just a warning, there are no true candles as they are not allowed, but got a nice little battery tea light.  While $36 seems steep for what you get, it   is a historical spot and enjoyed learning.

reviews.author: Shruti Go
reviews.text:
Amazing experience!!

The Catacombs tour was fascinating! Walking through the underground burial chambers beneath St. Patrick‚Äôs Old Cathedral gave me a real sense of NYC history and culture. The guide was knowledgeable and made the stories come alive. The candlelight setting added a mysterious and intimate atmosphere. Highly recommend for history buffs and anyone looking for something different in NYC.

reviews.author: TFT
reviews.text:
This was an engaging tour led by Lee, a very friendly guide well-versed in the history of St. Patrick‚Äôs Old Cathedral and the surrounding area.

We went around the courtyards and had a little peek at the beautiful church before heading down to the catacombs. It‚Äôs not at all scary- I‚Äôd sooner use the word ‚Äòmysterious‚Äô.

reviews.author: Talya Lerman
reviews.text: This is a hidden gem and widely unknown even by NYC natives! The tour guide was informative and provided little known facts. We were the only ones on the tour, so it felt very intimate and personalized. Highly recommend!

name: Questing NY
address: 9 Maiden Ln, New York, NY 10038

reviews.author: Sara
reviews.text:
A group of friends and I did the scavenger hunt (murder mystery) in the Seaport area (Financial District) and it was really well done‚Äîwe had such an amazing time from start to finish!
There was even a pleasant surprise at the end (but I won‚Äôt spoil it for you üôÇ).

I don‚Äôt know the creator of this game, so this is a truly honest review. If you have some free time and want to enjoy a fun and different afternoon with friends, I highly recommend it!

reviews.author: Peter H
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I found this last minute when we were looking to do something on a lazy Saturday. We chose the FiDi and Seaport quest it was great! The clues were challenging enough to be fun but not frustrating. Great excuse to get out on a nice day and explore a part of NYC that we don‚Äôt spend that much time in otherwise. We did all the side quests and it probably took us a little over 2 hours. Best part - no lines and you move at your own pace. Looking forward to trying a different one soon.

reviews.author: Jonathan Reed
reviews.text: Very unique scavenger hunt/national treasure search in NYC. Definitely do it with a group since each of us found different clues to progress. You learn quick to look everywhere within about a block of each corresponding clue, on the ground, across the street, or along the walls of a building. We were turned around maybe twice after misreading a clue here or there, and the app/browser had hints to help us find our next location. Can't wait to try another and hoping they create more hunts üôè

reviews.author: Rohit Nayak
reviews.text:
Loved the questing experience.

The clues were challenging enough (but not too much so) kept my nieces excited enough to keep going on until the end.

In all it was a wonderful experience for all of us.
For me (a 5.5 yr NYC resident) - learning about the nooks and crannies of the financial district and for my nieces - learning about NYC in a unique way.

Loved loved loved the experience and highly recommend this to the folks who want to experience NYC in a fun unique way.

reviews.author: Ashley Buechele
reviews.text: My kids and I had a blast on our Family Quest - we had so much fun running around and getting energy out while solving puzzles and learning new things about our neighborhood.  The Quest had perfectly timed snack stops and play destinations.  It was a wonderful way to spend an afternoon for all of us and to increase our wonder of and love for New York City.

name: The James
address: 4 Park Ave, New York, NY 10016

reviews.author: Joe Ahearn
reviews.text: I came to James with an incomprehensible riddle‚Äîa mystery that had plagued my family for generations. Although the price was steep, the detective assigned to my case got to work immediately. While the mystery is far from over, I‚Äôm quite confident that we‚Äôre on the way to unraveling this knot.

reviews.author: Lilian Holler
reviews.text: Top service, top people. Good space to work from (outlets!). Don't miss out.

reviews.author: Kait K.
reviews.text: Truly an eye opening experience! Don‚Äôt come to New York if this isn‚Äôt on your itinerary!

reviews.author: Adam A
reviews.text: In a word: life-changing

reviews.author: Greg Tourville
reviews.text:
Great people, great food, great experiences!

Art is life and live is love

name: Dr. Sun Yat-sen Plaza
address: Columbus Park, Mulberry Street &, Baxter St, New York, NY 10013

reviews.author: Tibor
reviews.text: The statue of Dr. Sun Yat-sen in Columbus Park is a peaceful and thoughtful corner in the middle of Chinatown. With benches, quiet locals, and soft evening light, it feels calm and full of quiet respect.

reviews.author: Johnny Yuen
reviews.text: A quiet gem located in the heart of Chinatown. People congregate here to play cards, practice music, and either sit to relax or play ball and exercise. The park is also family and dog friendly but be sure the dog is leashed because there are a lot of people and it's good to know that the dog is close by you. And after you have been thoroughly reinvigorated, there are many restaurants to try out before the day is done.

reviews.author: Salma Louisa Srour
reviews.text: An amazing park to wind down after the bustle of Canal street and Chinatown. A true community area with people playing mahjong, filming screenplays, and enjoying nature. An unexpected high from my trip to nyc!!

reviews.author: Alexander Williams
reviews.text: Old men & women playing go/mahjong and gossiping while drinking tea, someone playing an amplified pi-pao and singing in one corner and people playing soccer on the green. One of the more lively and pleasant parks in Manhattan, definitely worth visiting.

reviews.author: Dorothy Flores
reviews.text: The building is more symbolic than functional. The building once served as the famous politician's office, but it is now a theater with little connection to this story. The building is lovely and worth a visit.

name: Liberty Cruise
editorialSummary: Rides around the Statue of Liberty, plus panoramic views of New York City landmarks from the water.
address: 353 West St, New York, NY 10014

reviews.author: Olga Becciu
reviews.text:
Amazing experience at Liberty Cruise - skyline dinner Cruise !!! Highly recommended it for anyone visiting New York!!!
First of all you combine and check so many wonderful things in one trip. Starting for a boating experience/ delicious dinner / amazing service and ambience ! To fascinating view and gorgeous view point to the main attractions of New York!
We got so lucky to do it at 7pm-10pm and being able to see New York in a daylight and night time - difference makes it charming ! üíñ The crew was very nice and welcoming, friendly and helpful!
The cherry on top was the dj and his absolutely  energetic üé∂ music - we had so much fun!!!! Dance üíÉ and enjoyed so much!

reviews.author: Trae Al√©cia
reviews.text: Mommy & Son date, and we enjoyed ourselves. The look on my kid's face was enough for me! Convenient location at Pier 40, accessible between the Westside highway if you're driving or public transportation if you're not. A couple blocks west from the train. The staff were welcoming, the orator, comical, and the onboard refreshments overpriced. Approximately a 20oz cup of popcorn, a king-size bag of skittles, and a small cranberry juice ran me $15. I get it and understand a profit needs to be made. Arrive 15 mins or so early as the line starts to pick up. Digital tickets in advance are less expensive, while parking I was told, started at $50/hr when events were ongoing or $20.64/hr on a regular day (something similarly priced, don't quote me) at the same Pier. They leave on time! They don't mess around ü§£ and I read there's no refunds or cross honoring substitute sailings. They do accept tips after unboarding, which we gave generously, though my son felt a way he didn't get a verbal thank you. Just a look of acknowledgment.

reviews.author: D S
reviews.text: Cool cruise, BUT general admission DOES NOT GET TO SIT ON TOP. That is $20 extra per person. We got free tickets, so I paid for the upgrade. You get some good views of the city. Does not stop Ellis Island or the statue of liberty.

reviews.author: Kelli Medina
reviews.text: I loved going on this cruise with Liberty Cruise! The staff is so kind! And it was way cool to see so many different things from the water! You get to see Ellis Island, the Statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn Bridge and so much more! And I definitely recommend upgrading to the premium so you can have seats up top with the tour guide instead of being down below and trying to hear and see things.

reviews.author: mikeywow
reviews.text: Wow. What a fun experience this was for me and my fianc√©e. When we arrived to pier 40 we found paid parking. And then followed the signs for skyline dinner cruise. The boat was rocking back and forth. We thought we were gonna get sea sick. But nope. We were fine. Once we embarked it was a breeze. The boat was very clean and the staff was amazing. Very professional. We did a 3 hour cruise. And it was a beautiful site to see the city at night. It was breathtaking, seeing all the lights. From the manhattan bridge , Brooklyn bridge looked stunning. They‚Äôre was a dj playing great music. And my fiancee and I had a fabulous time. Thank you to the entire staff and everyone involved in making a date night and incredible time.

name: FDNY Memorial Wall
editorialSummary: Bronze bas-relief sculpture memorializing NYC firefighters who lost their lives in the 9/11 attacks.
address: 141 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10006

reviews.author: Stacy Mora
reviews.text: A Beautiful memorial tribute to the firefighters who lost their lives during the tragedy of the World Trade Center.  Worth the stop to appreciate and take it in.  It‚Äôs even more impactful given how close it is to the towers and really puts into perspective the gravity of the loss.

reviews.author: Eumika Wiggins
reviews.text: It was very nice and though the wall gets mention it‚Äôs attached to the 1st due (1st to arrive/respond to the trade center) fire station. The folks inside were great. I happened to meet them while take a picture. Please if you visit remember it‚Äôs a fire house 1st and folks are inside doing work as servants of the city and its people. Don‚Äôt block the bay doors or main exit points.

reviews.author: Tibor
reviews.text: This bronze memorial wall outside FDNY Engine 10/Ladder 10 is a powerful and emotional tribute to the firefighters of 9/11. The detailed relief shows scenes of bravery, chaos, and unity, capturing the spirit and sacrifice of those who responded, like a story frozen in metal. The words ‚ÄúDedicated to those who fell and to those who carry on‚Äù hit especially hard. If you‚Äôre near the 9/11 Memorial, take a moment here

reviews.author: Daniel Donnelly
reviews.text: Tasteful mural in relief to the NYFD who rushed in as was their duty as EPA Secretary Christine Whitman said, "The air's fine down here!" Except that it wasn't, and for years firemen and other first responders clung to life with pulmonary maladies which government pretended didn't exist. Once bitten, twice shy.

reviews.author: Christopher Lewis
reviews.text:
A poignant and moving memorial to pay respect to the brave members of FDNY that lost their lives as a result of the 9/11 attack.
It‚Äôs emotional seeing all the names of the people that lost their lives, saving the lives of others.

name: Pier 15 East River Esplanade
editorialSummary: Public pier with a 2-story structure for picnics & basking beside the river, plus a bar/cafe.
address: 78 South St, New York, NY 10006

reviews.author: Sanjay Gupta
reviews.text:
This two-level pier boasts a sleek, modern design. Pier 15 in Lower Manhattan offers a warm, inviting atmosphere with lush greenery and stunning views. Its open-air public space features observation decks on both levels.

When I visited, it was a cloudy day with hardly any crowd‚Äîpure tranquility. The calm, noise-free surroundings made the view of the Brooklyn Bridge even more captivating. Outdoor seating perfectly frames the breathtaking vistas of the Manhattan skyline, the Brooklyn Bridge, and passing cruise ships.

The pier is also home to the trendy Watermark restaurant, known for its stylish vibe and wide selection of beverages. It‚Äôs an ideal spot to enjoy a spectacular sunset.

P.S. There‚Äôs a public restroom available from 6 a.m. to midnight.

reviews.author: Q K
reviews.text:
Pier 15 is one of my favorite spots in New York City‚Äîit‚Äôs a peaceful escape right in the middle of all the action. From the moment you step onto the pier, you‚Äôre greeted with breathtaking panoramic views of the East River, the Brooklyn Bridge, and the Lower Manhattan skyline. Whether you‚Äôre visiting during the day or at sunset, the views never disappoint. The upper level offers an elevated perspective and is perfect for photos or just sitting quietly while taking in the scenery.

What I love most about Pier 15 is the atmosphere‚Äîit‚Äôs clean, well-kept, and never feels too crowded. There‚Äôs plenty of seating, including lounge-style benches and grassy areas where people can relax, have a snack, read, or even meditate. It‚Äôs ideal for a calm solo stroll or a romantic moment if you‚Äôre visiting with someone special. You can also see ferries coming and going, which adds to the charm and energy of the area.

It‚Äôs also conveniently located near the Seaport District, so it‚Äôs easy to grab a coffee or bite to eat nearby before or after visiting. Pier 15 manages to feel like a hidden gem despite being so central. I always leave feeling more grounded and refreshed. If you‚Äôre looking for a peaceful yet stunning spot to enjoy the beauty of New York, Pier 15 is absolutely worth the visit.

reviews.author: Ana M.
reviews.text: Great spring decoration settings. You have to pay general admission just to walk around and take pictures. There's a bar for orders and drinks, but to be inside of one of the igloo reservations is needed.

reviews.author: Lyuba Lyubov
reviews.text:
Pier 15  on the East River.
It has two levels‚Äîwalk below by the water or relax above with stunning views of the skyline and Brooklyn Bridge. Great for sunsets, photos, and peaceful breaks from the busy city. A perfect little escape in the heart of Manhattan.

reviews.author: Galyna Shulimova
reviews.text: This is one of the most scenic public areas in Downtown Manhattan.

name: Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises - Downtown
address: 89 South St, New York, NY 10038

reviews.author: Traveling Hope
reviews.text: One of my favorite parts of our NYC trip! Even on an 80 degree day, the top deck had a nice breeze and was very comfortable. We got beautiful views of the buildings and awesome photo ops with the Statue of Liberty as well! We did the express tour which was perfect timewise as we had a short trip and a lot to pack into two days. Highly recommend! Our tour guide Debbie also gave funny and entertaining commentary throughout the trip!

reviews.author: Jon Cass #11
reviews.text:
The perfect way to get to liberty Island and Ellis island.
Good sturdy boats, friendly crew.
Fab views on deck of the city.
Lots of good seating and plenty of standing room to view.
Really quite enjoyed our little cruise, 100% recommend them.

reviews.author: Rina du Plessis
reviews.text:
FANTASTIC experience.  Our Guide was Debbie, she is such a delight! The highlight of our trip to New York was the Sun set statue of liberty cruise.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

reviews.author: Salv√∂r Davidsdottir
reviews.text:
We loved it!! We were traveling in March, but got good weather on the boat. Recommend being on the top floor for the view. Be aware the ride is bumpy, and you got to be careful.
There was a live tour guide, which I love, love, love. It adds this personal touch to the trip. Our guide was amazing - entertaining with great knowledge, and had a great deal of travel tips, along with do‚Äôs and don‚Äôts in NYC. The length of the tour was just right. Thank you Circle Line for helping us create great memories ‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.author: Brandon Robinette
reviews.text: The statue at sunset cruise was very cool. The staff were very friendly and willing to assist you with information or taking pictures. I would definitely recommend Circle Line Cruises.

name: Wat Arun Viewing Point
address: 89 Thanon Maha Rat, Khwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200

reviews.author: Shibin K Benny
reviews.text:
Beautiful temple built right on the river with amazing views all around. Perfect for photos.

There are many shops nearby that rents out traditional Thai wear. You must take that. It‚Äôs a great experience.

A ferry ride from here takes you to Wat Pho. It feels like a totally different place.

reviews.author: Adv Surabhi Sawant
reviews.text:
We visited the Wat Arun viewing point a little after sunset, and the experience was absolutely magical. While most people go to catch the sunset, we got to see the temple beautifully lit up at night, and it was stunning!

The view of Wat Arun glowing across the river, with cruises gently passing by and lights reflecting off the water, felt like a scene from a postcard. The whole vibe was peaceful, calm, and picture perfect.

Even though we missed the actual sunset, the night view was totally worth it. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a quieter, more serene experience by the river.

üì∏ Tip: Bring a good camera or phone for some amazing night shots!

reviews.author: Jit choudhary
reviews.text:
One of the most popular spots to take a shot at Wat Arun and ready for entry üé´ . Note that there‚Äôs no parking space available so it‚Äôs better to get here by public transport or walking. Also this location is not for you to cross the river to Wat Arun on the other side of the river. You should go to Thatien pier for that and it‚Äôs only 5-10 minutes walk away and it costs 25 Bht per person or a get daily pass for 150 bht as we got daily to ride ferry around grand place from wat Arun. Great place to get rich experience of other Thai and Hindu cultures and you can sit in garden for relax have some coffee juice around the corner. I definitely recommend to hire a photographer as statues around you and it won‚Äôt fit in your phone cam unless your skilled.

Note that there are a lot of Tuk Tuk and taxi drivers nearby on the main road who like to rip off or scam tourists. Just be careful about their offer or try to avoid them if possible.

reviews.author: Aditya Fajar Pratama
reviews.text:
IT'S SO CROWDED DURING THE SUNSET!

But it's all worth the wait, first I would go to the Eagle Cafe near the viewing point, but turned out a failure, I didn't get a sit chair dand it's so full, so I decided to go back to this point, and it's still fine with all the crowd. You can see Wat Arun across the river and gives you chill when it comes to sunset! The siluate is killing every best part of it!

reviews.author: Dewa Yudhi
reviews.text: Tucked away in a small lane, I didn‚Äôt expect the facility to be this nicely designed. It‚Äôs best to come at night to enjoy the beautiful lights from the temple and the passing ferries. You can take a boat or ferry from ICONSIAM and stop at Rajinee Pier, then take a short walk to reach this spot.

reviews.author: Colibr√≠ M√©xico
reviews.text: I reserved this tour through Expedia and the tour company never responded to my emails, calls or WhatsApp messages to confirm hotel pick-up. I waited at my hotel at the indicated time, and they never picked me up. I tried to get a refund through Expedia and they said the vendor declined. I think this company is a scam. Fighting it now with my credit card.

reviews.author: Ames G.
reviews.text: This Hangover tour was super fun in 2018 but this time was a waste of time and money. They took us to a boring Patpong museum and then a bunch of strip joints. The hosts were 2 young guys who were nice but very quiet and awkward.  We actually requested to end the tour early and left. I do not recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Gopi Padala
reviews.text: This is Soi Cowboy which is a great place for partying and hot girls

reviews.author: Fahad Chy
reviews.text: Nice

reviews.author: peter thomas
reviews.text:
My wife and I booked the Hangover tour from Aus not sure of what we were going to experience -  It was everything and more.
From the moment we were collected by our tour guide Ayam, we were treated like royalty.  Ayam ensured we had VIP treatment wherever we visited, ensured our safety, and explained the shows and the expectations whilst in the venues.  I cannot rave more highly about this tour.  Thanks Ayam.

name: Chinatown Bangkok / Yaowarat
address: PGR5+4XP, Yaowarat Rd, Khwaeng Samphanthawong, Khet Samphanthawong, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10100

reviews.author: Damian Felczak
reviews.text: Exploring the area offers a unique experience filled with vibrant energy. The bustling streets showcase a rich culture and a variety of shops. One can easily get lost in the maze-like pathways filled with exotic aromas. The blend of traditional and modern elements creates a captivating atmosphere. Undoubtedly, it is a destination that promises unforgettable memories and culinary delights.

reviews.author: KT
reviews.text:
Completely overcrowded! So full you can barely walk. Very noisy, loud and polluted. Cars everywhere.
Mainly tourists here, which means that food at those street stalls and vendors is way below par.

Nevertheless, you should definitely visit once. It's recommended to visit in night time as you can see those lights illuminating the whole street.

Nice photo spot but unfortunately tourist masses has destroyed the former beauty. I guess that's what happens to places where mostly tourists go. Luckily there aren't many of these so-called 'hotspots' in Bangkok.

reviews.author: Mahir Hussain
reviews.text: A lively area full of energy, flavors, and local charm. Street food stalls and fruit vendors line the roads, offering everything from grilled seafood to fresh mangoes. Tuk-tuks zip through the busy streets, adding to the fun atmosphere. It can get crowded, but the food and vibrant vibe make it a must-visit spot in Bangkok.

reviews.author: UEM
reviews.text:
Bangkok's Chinatown is incredible, and I've experienced it both day and night. The contrast is huge!
‚ÄãAt night, it's all about the food. The main street is packed and feels a bit overwhelming, but I loved exploring the side alleys. I found a fantastic soup stand on Pahurat Road, right on the corner with Yaowarat Road. The old couple who runs it makes a soup unlike anything I've tasted in Thailand before‚Äîit was a real highlight.
‚ÄãDuring the day, it's a completely different vibe. The area is a busy hub for locals, full of people going about their daily lives. I really enjoyed walking around and seeing all the different shops and markets. You can find all kinds of trades at work here. And of course, the Chinese-Thai food is absolutely amazing. The whole neighborhood shows how important Chinese immigration is to Thai history and culture.

reviews.author: Stan Pechner
reviews.text: A street photographers dream! I loved my two week day afternoon visits to BKK Chinatown! There is something for everyone, from food to souvenirs sightseeing. Sure it can busy and crowded, but so what, that's what it's all about. Get off the main street and pole around the alleyways and side streets. That's where the real action is. From small manufacturing to that hidden local eatery. Go! Have fun.

reviews.author: Xoom Too
reviews.text: This is one of Alex Face‚Äôs street art pieces that‚Äôs located in the Chinatown area that is one of the well-known character having the top part of it‚Äôs head opened and flowers flowing up and out and with mismatched colored eyes. It‚Äôs in color and honestly very pretty. It‚Äôs very striking and easy to notice as it‚Äôs quite big and is the only street art piece I saw.

reviews.author: Reiseblog Couchabenteurer (Couchabenteurer)
reviews.text: Absolute stunning mural and worth the way. Especially if you combine this place with the markets and restaurants at the market. For me as a street art lover, an absolute recommendation.

reviews.author: Farangondiet

reviews.author: Dr. Y. Loh

reviews.author: Thomas Kunz

name: Khao San Road
address: 161, 163 Thanon Khao San, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200

reviews.author: Trishoya Grant
reviews.text:
Based on the few short hours I spent on this road this is not an extensive review. The road was busy with lots of businesses catering to the tourist wallet so to speak. It‚Äôs hard to know which business to go to for a genuine taste of Bangkok - as most seem to cater for the foreign pallet. Locals don‚Äôt hassle you but they will try to get your attention a couple of time to spend with them which is expected.
This road is known to be a better experience in the evening when things get livelier and the temperature is cooler.

reviews.author: Sagar Bhoite
reviews.text:
A Must-Visit Spot for Nightlife Lovers!
This place truly comes alive in the evening and late into the night. The atmosphere is electric‚Äîlike stepping into a different world. From vibrant street shopping and lively open bars to music and spontaneous dancing, there‚Äôs something for everyone. It‚Äôs energetic yet feels safe and well-managed‚Äîa very decent place to enjoy the nightlife without worries. Highly recommended for anyone looking to soak in the local vibe!

reviews.author: Cleb Anthony Feliciano
reviews.text: Khao San Road is such a fun and vibrant place! The atmosphere is always lively and full of music, lights, and people from all over the world. What really stood out to me was how friendly the locals were, always smiling and welcoming. There‚Äôs a huge variety of food options, from authentic Thai street food to international bites, plus tons of bars with different vibes. Great spot to eat, drink, meet people, and just soak in the Bangkok energy. Definitely worth a visit!

reviews.author: Steve Hilton
reviews.text:
Khao San Road is still busy, has a great vibe and is a fun place to party.

As expected, if you visit in the day, it‚Äôs much quieter and the vibe is totally different to what it is in the evening.

Since there are many bars offering different happy hour deals, to ensure you choose the right bar for you, I would definitely recommend you walk all the way along Khao San Road.

In addition to bars, there are a few clubs, street food stalls and plenty of shopping available.

Enjoy üçª

reviews.author: Par Nmv
reviews.text:
This is one of my favorite places in Bangkok by far !wild, vibrant, full of life! It was just a short walk from our hotel, which made it super convenient to explore day and night.
One of the craziest and most unforgettable things I did there was trying scorpion, cockroach, and caterpillar worms from the street vendors. Yup ‚Äî I actually ate all of them! I also had grilled crocodiles and tons of other delicious street food. It‚Äôs a food lover‚Äôs paradise, especially if you‚Äôre into bold, adventurous eats.
I also got a traditional Thai foot massage right there on the street, surrounded by music, laughter, and the buzz of travelers from all over the world. The vibe was unbeatable ‚Äî energetic but laid-back at the same time. It truly felt like the soul of Bangkok.
If you‚Äôre visiting Bangkok, don‚Äôt skip Khao San Road. It's chaotic in the best way and packed with culture, flavors, and unforgettable moments.

address: 148 ‡∏ñ. ‡∏ö‡∏≥‡∏£‡∏∏‡∏á‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏©‡∏é‡∏£‡πå‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏∑‡∏≠ Khwaeng Khlong Toei Nuea, Watthana, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10110

reviews.author: Phuong Dang
reviews.text: Bangkok is a city of contrasts ‚Äî the luxurious, bustling city center stands in stark contrast to the peaceful, sometimes impoverished riverside areas.

reviews.author: Zainal
reviews.text: This metal and cement walkway near Nana Nua Pier and Bumrungrad International Hospital in Bangkok offers a serene escape along a bustling canal. Just a 15-minute walk from these landmarks, the path is well-maintained and sturdy, providing excellent views of the grand Wat Ditsahongsaram across the water. Mostly frequented by locals, it offers a peaceful setting to observe canal boats, especially on a shady day. The tranquil atmosphere and scenic views make it a pleasant spot for a leisurely stroll or a quiet moment of reflection.

reviews.author: Pillappan K
reviews.text: Excellent place for walking along the the river canal. Shows you the other view of Bangkok, the Venice of the east.

reviews.author: Pierre Duwooz
reviews.text:
A perfect walk by the canal. Gone is the hustle and bustle of the city. The occasional boat passing by reminds you Bangkok is only a few steps off the walkway.
Some amazing local food and drink stores along the way where everyone is so friendly and welcoming. I found these are cheaper and better quality than some stores in more tourist areas.
Take some time out of your day and take a walk along the canal.

reviews.author: Andre Parent
reviews.text: Walkway by canal. No obvious exit. Your might want to take the train track back or backtrack your steps

I had passed by here when I was walking through the weekend market, but I didn‚Äôt realize it at the time.

name: King Power Mahanakhon
editorialSummary: A 78-floor mirrored skyscraper used for hotel rooms & retail with a viewing deck at 1,030 feet.
address: 114 Thanon Naradhiwat Rajanagarindra, Si Lom, Khet Bang Rak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10500

reviews.author: Majedul Islam Khan
reviews.text:
I had an awesome day at the Bangkok Skywalk! The entire experience was breathtaking from start to finish. As soon as I stepped onto the skywalk, I was greeted with panoramic views of the Bangkok skyline that were nothing short of stunning. The glass floor adds an exciting thrill, giving you the feeling of walking in the sky ‚Äî definitely not for the faint of heart, but incredibly memorable.

The area was well-maintained, and the staff were friendly and helpful, ensuring everyone felt safe and comfortable. Whether you‚Äôre a local or a tourist, this is a must-visit attraction to truly appreciate the beauty and vibrancy of Bangkok from above.

Highly recommended for photographers, adventurers, or anyone wanting a unique cityscape experience. I‚Äôd love to visit again at sunset for that golden-hour magic!

reviews.author: Kaz KEN
reviews.text: The ambiance here is quite lovely, offering a sense of relaxation. The environment is very comfortable, making it easy to unwind and de-stress. I appreciate the well-chosen music, which truly enhances the experience. Its soothing tunes create a perfect backdrop for conversation or quiet reflection. Overall, it is a wonderful place to spend some time.

reviews.author: Jinky Dabon
reviews.text:
The Day I Dared to Tilt 65¬∫ Above Bangkok

I arrived early in the morning, which meant a short wait at Mahanakhon Eatery before the adventure began. Thankfully, I had prebooked my tickets‚Äîno queuing, no hassle. This was my third time ascending to 314 metres for a panoramic morning view of Bangkok. Fewer people, more peace. Though the heat was intense, it offered a completely different vibe from previous evening visits.

The lift to the 74th floor Observation Deck took just 50 seconds‚Äîso fast that some guests even felt their ears pop. Once at the top, there is a massive space to roam and snap photos. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful, patiently guiding through the experience. I was even able to store my belongings for free‚Äîjust remember to keep your ticket to retrieve them later. Pack light so you can move freely around the deck.

On the 74th floor, you can enjoy drinks, use the toilets, ice cream corner, beverages, and souvenirs. It‚Äôs a great spot to pause and take in the view before heading even higher.

On the 78th floor, the glass tray suspended over 300 metres above Bangkok is absolutely breathtaking. You‚Äôre not allowed to bring your phone onto the tray, so plan your shots from the side‚Äîsun glare can obscure the view beneath the glass. From here, you can climb even higher to the city‚Äôs highest accessible point. Each level offers cosy seating and jaw-dropping views. There‚Äôs even a bar and coffee shop to unwind while soaking it all in.

The ‚ÄòI-Tilt‚Äô challenge is located on the 75th floor, the I-Tilt lets you lean out from the building‚Äôs edge at a thrilling 65-degree angle for two minutes. At 296 metres above ground, it‚Äôs the only outdoor platform where you can truly feel the wind on your face. You‚Äôll wear a watch to monitor your heart rate‚Äîdefinitely not for the faint-hearted or those new to high-altitude adventures.
Complete the challenge and you‚Äôll earn a Certificate of Courage‚Äîproof that you looked up,  stared down the sky and didn‚Äôt blink.

On the way down, stop at Level 4 to explore the Mahanakhon Skyverse‚Äîa stunning interactive digital museum with nine immersive zones. Afterward, you‚Äôll pass through the shopping counters and arrive at the lobby, where the TukTuk Quest awaits. Don‚Äôt miss the ‚ÄòGreat Wall of China‚Äô VR challenge‚Äîit‚Äôs exhilarating and fun!

From the glass-floor skywalk to the adrenaline-pumping I-Tilt, the futuristic Skyverse, and the playful TukTuk Quest‚Äîthis experience is packed with unforgettable moments. If you‚Äôre craving adventure and ready to challenge your limits, this is a must-visit destination.

reviews.author: Fisher Richard
reviews.text: it‚Äôs amazing to see the view from the top of the tower.  The sunset was stunning.  The glass walk made me scared and excited at the same time.  Highly recommended to visit it here and the show after the tour to the top  of the building was great.

reviews.author: Tomas Rehorek
reviews.text: It's a bit pricy for the experience, but I am happy we did it. The views are unbeatable. The tower is in a neighborhood with other high-rise buildings, which creates amazing panorama. Skywalk can raise the heartbeat with the first step but you should definitely jump on!! The beverages are extremely expensive, as expected. Small beer-280 BTH. You can not bring a backpack even of small size upstairs, but there are free storage bins. The "laser show" on the 4th floor is also very nice, but it was extremely crowded at some spots. In total, there were 9 rooms, each slightly different.  We didn't buy the tickets upfront, and there was no queue. The basic one is 1200 BTH.

reviews.text: Well, that wasn't worth the journey. The only painting left us this one. The other picture has been graffitied over. Maybe by a bitter Everton fan. üòÜ Unless you're down that way, I wouldn't bother going. There is a beautiful temple just around the corner though.

reviews.author: Md Rafikul Islam (Rafi)
reviews.text: "Liverpool Graffiti Art, Soi Charoen Krung 33" is a mesmerizing showcase of urban creativity in the heart of Bangkok. Nestled in the vibrant neighborhood of Charoen Krung, this hidden gem features an impressive array of colorful and thought-provoking street art. From vibrant murals depicting local culture to abstract pieces that challenge the imagination, each artwork tells a unique story and adds character to the bustling streetscape. Exploring this graffiti art scene is like embarking on a visual journey through Liverpool's cultural tapestry, with every corner offering a new discovery. Whether you're a seasoned art enthusiast or simply a curious passerby, a visit to Liverpool Graffiti Art promises an immersive and memorable experience in the vibrant streets of Bangkok.

Each piece is quite different from eachother so even though there aren‚Äôt a ton they each pop in their own way especially being put next to eachother. Great place if you wandered by it, or are in the area.

name: Bangkok Elephant Tour (Living Green Elephant Sanctuary)
address: 154, 1 Thanon Ram Buttri, Khwaeng Talat Yot, Khet Phra Nakhon, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10200

reviews.author: Samia Dumani
reviews.text:
The Living Green Elephant Experience was absolutely magical! What I loved most is that it‚Äôs not a typical tourist attraction‚Äîit‚Äôs a sanctuary where elephants are genuinely respected and cared for in their natural habitat. We got to learn about their quirky personalities, feed them, and even walk alongside them‚Äîit felt like spending time with old friends!

The team is so passionate and makes the whole experience fun, educational, and truly heartwarming. If you want an adventure that‚Äôs both ethical and unforgettable, this is it!

reviews.author: Sth Queensland Children's Ministries
reviews.text: This was an incredible experience. We started with a locally made vegetarian pad Thai and plenty of cold water was made available all through the tour. You were able to feed the elephants, walk through their environment, get up close and take a bath with them. I was amazed at how much time and opportunity there was to interact with them even with a large tour group. The guides were very knowledgeable and I learned so much about the elephants and what they do at the sanctuary. I would visit again and recommended to everyone to experience this.

reviews.author: Maria Dayeel
reviews.text: This sanctuary is absolutely amazing!! I would 100% recommend to anyone and everyone the experience from getting picked up to arriving was smooth. When we arrived the guid Mod was amazing and informative you can tell he really cares and loves the elephant. He showed us where the elephant are, which one is which, how to feed them and care for them. During his experience we fed the elephant trekked with them and bathed them all freely. You can tell the elephant are well looked after and taken care of they are just roaming around in their habitat this was a one in a life time experience I would again 100000% recommend this to anyone coming to Bangkok Thailand

reviews.author: Aa A
reviews.text:
I had a wonderful visit to Living Green Elephant Sanctuary  today.
Mod was a fantastic guide for the day- very kind. knowledgeable and humorous too!
The elephants are all very well looked after and you have the opportunity to feed them and bathe with them.
And they serve a very tasty pad Thai for lunch.
Highly recommended experience!

reviews.author: Meka Sanpuwa
reviews.text: We were given so many opportunities to see and interact with many of the elephants which gave a very up-close and fun experience! The tour leaders were very friendly, informative, and assured that everybody had a chance to take photos and get a close look at the elephants. We were also provided with lots of cold water and freshly cooked pad Thai which they had accommodations for those allergic to eggs, tofu or needed a gluten-free option! Overall, I found my experience here to be terrific and I would highly recommend this to anybody travelling in Thailand and looking for something fun to do! :D

Cute! Ma Win was on duty when we arrived so we got to bathe in the majesty that is this beautiful street cat. We brought small treats and became instant friends.

We also shared treats with another little beasty. It‚Äôs cat central around there üòç

The best attraction in Bangkok by far, the calmest and best cat in the world.
I'm sorry I only saw him in the last few days, but it's better to see than to never see.
If you're close by, I highly recommend waiting for him because when he arrives, he arrives!

reviews.author: Mr. T
reviews.text: Today I was fortunate enough to witness Ma win in his full glory after missing him a few times. His presence exceeded all expectations. He was chilling in his motorcycle vest and looked really cool. Well worth the Bangkok trip. Awesome cat 10/10

reviews.text: The cutest cat and my fave tourist attraction of my trip üòç we couldn‚Äôt find him at first but the kind motorbike taxi driver helped us look for him, it‚Äôs obvious that this cat is very well taken care of ü•∞ very wholesome üò≠

reviews.author: Fred Liu
reviews.text:
Cute cat that the motorcycle taxi drivers take care of. There's a cat bed with food and water and the cat even has an orange jacket!

When it's hot the cat can be cooling off nearby - we found him under a food stall. A motosai driver was kind enough to lure him out for us!

I recommend to bring some food or water for the cat to share the feeding costs.

name: Catsmile Cafe
address: 15 15/1 Khwaeng Chatuchak, Khet Chatuchak, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon 10900

reviews.author: Salvatore Bivona
reviews.text: This is an amazing and welcoming experience. My cousin and I walked half an hour to this cafe and we are very satisfied. There are an abundance of cats like Caracals, babies, and prairie dogs. The staff at this cafe and food are amazing as well. You could that the staff take amazing care of these animals and treat them with love. This is an amazing tourist destination so if you are in Bangkok. Check this place out!

reviews.author: Shiina02
reviews.text:
Many cats.
Clean environment.
entrance was smelly, but once entered into the main room, it's nice with many cats, some sleeping, and playing around, we get to choose a free drink upon entering.

Can also feed the cats free by asking the workers.

Cats were chill. Nobody was there as well. It feels like you got the entire cafe to yourself!

reviews.author: TazzysTravels
reviews.text:
My husband and I stumbled upon this cat caf√© by chance, and we were warmly welcomed by the friendly staff. For 200 baht, you get a drink and some chicken to feed the cats; a great little package. The space was clean, tidy, and filled with plenty of adorable cats. One of the unique features of this caf√© is that, in addition to the cats, they also have a caracal and some prairie dogs, which makes for an unusual and memorable experience.

However, I did have some concerns. A noticeable number of the cats seemed unwell, with runny noses, eye or ear infections, and one in particular appeared to be struggling to breathe due to a severely blocked nose. We visited around 9 p.m., and while the staff were kind, not many spoke English fluently at that time, so I couldn‚Äôt easily ask about the cats I was worried about.

Overall, I enjoyed my time there, but I left feeling concerned about the health of some of the cats.

reviews.author: Kritatas
reviews.text: They have a feisty caracal, Pierre dogs and lots and lots of cats. Very humane.

reviews.author: Andrew Turner
reviews.text:
Had a wonderful time here, well priced with drink included and no time limit to spend there, owners were nice and helpful and gave us chicken to feed the cats, we went at around 7pm and most cats were up and about, some sleeping, definitely recommend to anyone who loves cats.
Also don‚Äôt take notice of some bad reviews, those people need to get a life and live a little and maybe gain some common sense especially ‚ÄúAugust Dine‚Äù .
Please come and support this business!

reviews.author: Khunakorn D
reviews.text:
Songwat 100-Year Gateway ‚Äì A Hidden Gem for Urban Explorers üåü

If you're looking for a spot that blends history with modern charm, Songwat 100-Year Gateway is the place to be! üì∏ Perfect for selfies, this chic location offers an aesthetic mix of vintage architecture and trendy backdrops.

üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Just a 1-minute walk from the river, you can soak in stunning views and enjoy a relaxing stroll along the water.

üçΩÔ∏è Food, Art, and Fashion ‚Äì Whether you're here for delicious street eats, unique handmade crafts, or stylish finds, Songwat has it all.

Definitely a must-visit for those who love exploring culture, creativity, and great vibes!

reviews.author: AMPORN NOEISONGSUK
reviews.text: It's really amazing. Thanon Song Wat, Bangkok, is a perfect blend of old and modern. We Thais are just finding out. Next time we go, we must go for a full day. Half a day really isn't enough. The shops and food are all unique. I recommend the Opium bar. Inside there is a Michelin-starred restaurant. We secretly went for a light cocktail before walking. It was quite enjoyable. We went to eat fish noodles, but went to the wrong place a bit. Next time we must go and get revenge.

name: Thanon Thaniya
address: „Äí10500 Bangkok, Bang Rak, Bangkok, Thaniya Rd, Unnamed Road

reviews.author: Tony Ng
reviews.text:
It is also known as "Japan Street" in Bangkok.
Obviously it is catered for specific group of patron.

reviews.author: Harry
reviews.text: A lot of women sit here waiting for you Ôºåsay hello

reviews.author: ra kawa
reviews.text: Located near Saladaeng Station and Patpong Road, Thaniya Road in Bangkok is known as Japantown and has a unique atmosphere. With signs in Japanese and rows of Japanese restaurants, karaoke bars, and izakayas, it feels like you've wandered into a corner of Tokyo's downtown. At night, the neon lights shine, and the area bustles with tourists, expatriates, and Japanese people working there, creating a sense of security despite being in a foreign country. However, with its many bars and clubs, the area also has a strong adult social atmosphere, creating a lively yet slightly mysterious atmosphere. There are also local food stalls, and the natural fusion of Japanese and Thai cultures is fascinating, making even a short stroll worthwhile. For travelers, this street offers a special experience of experiencing Japan in a foreign land.

reviews.author: qiang jiang
reviews.text: There are many places in Bangkok nicknamed Japan Street. If you are looking for a Japanese street to sing KTV with girls, this is it. The price of an hour of escort is 600 to 800b. There is no experience. It is a short street maze flashing.

reviews.author: T.S
reviews.text: Thaniya, the entertainment district for Japanese people in Bangkok, has a sad feeling at night, with few Japanese people around. Recently, I have come to visit the street not as a social gathering place at night, but to look around the golf shops at Thaniya Plaza and to shop at Donki during the day.

name: Ping Yeung Mural Village
address: Hong Kong, Âù™Ê¥≤Âù™Ê¥ãÊùëÂù™ÂéüË∑Ø157ËôüËèØÈÄπÂúí

reviews.author: Helen Yu (Chestnut Journal)
reviews.text: It‚Äôs a humble rural village enlivened by the beautiful mural paintings that were the work of the villagers and volunteers in their effort to stop the government‚Äôs resumption of village land. By telling their stories, the villagers reached out to sympathisers, and they were no longer anonymous to the people of Hong Kong. It does not take very long to tour the mural paintings but there is a Miscanthus field there too.

reviews.author: EastMeetsWest
reviews.text: Although there are only a few pictures in the area, it is nicely done and I loved their creative juice.  There is also some sculptures around. Worth a visit.

reviews.author: kam-ling CHIU
reviews.text:
Ping yeung Mural Village.
A 52 K green Mini bus departs from Fanling Station to Kau kee Store. Suggest to alight at Ping Che Village Administrative office.
Walking along the paved  road of Ping Yeung Kit Tin for about 300 m a Y junction of the road will be seen. There is a Variety store. Go alongside of the store to your left, the entrance of the Mural Village starts. It only continues for 350M but on both side  of the village road many colourful pictures and writings can be seen including some artistic animals made from metal wire and bulbs.
It is a unique village with drawings and murals, not many of these in HK now, only few can be found, such as   in Lamma Island , Peng Chau, Kam Tin.
Written on june22-2022

reviews.author: Big Dream
reviews.text:
Have a short cut from the Taoist Temple, Wun Chuen Sin Koon.
Go straight to the Stramberry Farm then cross the stramberry field,
follow the path always on your right and you will finish at the "village" main alley.
No car no taffic here, nice place to enjoy few selfies with friends.

reviews.author: CK Cheong
reviews.text: A fairytale-like cultural wonderland in Moscow's Izmailovo District. It is set up as a cultural center and marketplace loosely modeled after traditional Russian architecture and fairytale depictions of Old Russia. The colorful and bustling complex hosts several museums such as one for Russian folk art, another for bread, and yet another for vodka.

name: Tsar Cannon
address: Ivanovskaya Ploshchad', Moskva, 119072

reviews.author: Axel
reviews.text: The Tsar Cannon, a beautiful and iconic symbol of Russian history, stands within the Moscow Kremlin. Cast in bronze in 1586, its colossal size and ornate decorations showcase the craftsmanship of its time. Visiting the Tsar Cannon offers a glimpse into Russia's storied past and is a must-see attraction for anyone exploring Moscow.

reviews.text: It was an interesting fat Cannon that around it was crowded and everybody was taking photos with it :) the balls was cute and the color of the pipe was beautiful, the artwork on it was very interesting as well, it seems like an art work not a weapon for war, it's like paint or sculpture. The balls was perfectly spherical.

reviews.author: CK Cheong
reviews.text: This is a monument of Russian artillery casting art commissioned in 1586 by Russian Tsar Feodor Ivanovich and cast by Andrey Chokhov. Mainly symbolic, it was never used in a war. The cannon weighs 38 metric tons with length of 5.34 m, a calibre of 890 mm, and an external diameter of 1200 mm.

reviews.author: Brad
reviews.text:
One of the interesting things to see at the Kremlin is the Tsar Cannon located just outside the Ivan the Great Bell Tower. This is a medieval style artillery piece of silly proportion, more of a spectacle then an effective instrument of war.

Cast in bronze in 1586, the Tsar Cannon is recognised by the Guinness Book of World Records as the largest on its kind in the world. The Tsar Cannon is huge and fun to see. Be patient with the crowds and you will eventually be able to take unobstructed photos or have your own picture taken next to the cannon.

Note: Another similar large scale item is the enormous Tsar Bell located not far away on the other side of the Ivan the Great Bell Tower. It is worth having a look-see as well.

reviews.author: Vasilis Kosmidis
reviews.text: Very impressive cannon, a real work of art rather than a weapon! Weighting almost 40 tonnes, is in the Guinness book of records!

name: Nulevoy Kilometr
address: Proyezd Voskresenskiye Vorota, 1–ê, Moskva, 109012

reviews.author: Brad
reviews.text:
One of the interesting attractions to see at the Red Square in Moscow is the small chapel just outside Resurrection Gate next to the State Historical Museum.

This is a decorative, teal green chapel adorned with gilded figures on the facade as well as a angelic figure holding the Russian Orthodox cross atop the chapel. The roof has a celestial pattern. It is a small but attractive building to view.

The chapel was closed during our visit in July so not sure if you can enter and see the interior of the Chapel of Iver Icon of Our Lady. However, the exterior is attractive and makes for nice pictures. Give Chapel of Iver Icon of Our Lady a few minutes to enjoy during before passing through the Resurrection Gate to see the rest of the Red Square.

reviews.author: Fan
reviews.text:
The kilometer marking is a common thing in Russia and is in a lot of cities. It illustrates from where all distances from a city are measured.

It is usually situated at the head post office.

The location is around the Red Square, just right from the 1812 war museum.

Though, this is not the real kilometer mark from Moscow. The real one is situated at the Central Telegraph Office on Nikitsky Lane 7.

‚ÄúAll roads lead to Moscow‚Äù so I have been told. Stand in the middle and throw a coin over your shoulder and make a wish.

name: Solovetsky Stone
editorialSummary: This large stone in a public square honors the political prisoners of the Soviet Gulag system.

reviews.author: mahbub382
reviews.text: Nice place, most importantly the stones will make u surprised. The¬†Solovetsky Stone¬†is a monument located in¬†Lubyanka Square¬†in¬†Moscow, across from¬†KGB headquarters. The monument consists of a large stone brought from the¬†Solovetsky Islands, the location of¬†Solovki prison camp, part of the Soviet¬†Gulag¬†system. The monument was erected in 1990 to honor victims of political suppression in the Soviet Union.

reviews.author: Alejandro Mansilla Cruz
reviews.text:
Powerful symbol of the Gulag history.

The massive stone was brought here 30 years ago from the Solovki camp up north by activists of the Memorial movement. It is intended to represent both the heavy weight of loss and the steadfast solidary effort of memory.

Every year on the 29th of October people come here, in front of the KGB/FSB headquarters, to read aloud the names of Stalin's terror victims, one or two names each, in an impressive ritual of rememberance that lasts all day. Thousands read every year, yet it will be decades before the list is over.

reviews.author: Michael Lashkevich
reviews.text: It is a place of memory of millions of victims of Soviet regime. For me it is the most important place in Moscow.

reviews.author: Brad
reviews.text:
One of the interesting things to see at Manezhnaya Square is the Fountain World Clock, just above the Okhotny Ryad Shopping Center.

Here you see a circular glass dome displaying the northern hemisphere with numerous major cities. While in operation, the World Clock dome is supposed to rotate continuously. There are also water spouts filling the basin which surrounds the World Clock.

Unfortunately, we found this interesting fountain to be shut down for restorations during our recent visit to Moscow. While not operating, we were able to see the fountain well from our hotel room at Hotel National. You can also see it from within the Okhotny Ryad shopping centre at the basement level, looking upwards.

However, the surrounding environment was good, sitting on one of the benches enjoying the view of the great buildings and beautiful sunshine was a wonderful thing to do.

name: Triumfal'naya Arka
editorialSummary: Oldest surviving triumphal arch that was built to commemorate Russia's victory over Napoleon.
address: Kutuzovsky Ave, Moskva, 121170

reviews.author: Oleg Naumov
reviews.text:
Moscow Triumphal Gate was built in 1829-1834 by Russian architect Giuseppe Bova (1784-1834). Giuseppe Bova was the son of Italian painter who came to Russia and found here new Fatherland. Triumphal Gate was dedicated to the Victory of Russian Imperial Army over Napoleon Bonaparte in 1812-1814 and replaced wooden arch them met Russian returning from Paris in 1814. Gate was disassembled in 1936 according to plans of reconstruction of Moscow. It was assembled again only in 1966-68 but at another place. Now you can see that Triumphal Gate at Kutuzovsky Prospect near Museum Panorama "The Battle of Borodino".
Moscow, üá∑üá∫ Russian Federation üá∑üá∫. October 13, 2022.

reviews.author: Ivan Muracciole (Maind Framend)
reviews.text:
Magical!!!!

A building at 23 Nikolskaya Street in the center of Moscow will be restored ‚Äì the so-called "Execution House".

As reported on the website of the Moscow City Committee for the Implementation of Investment Projects in Construction and Control over Shared Construction, the urban planning and land commission headed by Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin gave its consent to the preparation of the documents necessary for the work today.

The total area of the three-story building exceeds two thousand square meters. The building has the status of a cultural heritage site of regional significance.

According to the Moscow City Committee for the Implementation of Investment Projects in Construction and Control over Shared Construction, the building is currently not used in any way, and the investor intends to restore it.

The building received the unofficial name of the Execution House in the 1930s. It housed the Military Collegium of the Supreme Court of the USSR (VKVS), which considered cases of those accused of treason. This collegium sentenced more than 30 thousand people to death: military personnel, engineers, scientists, cultural and artistic figures. In Moscow, they were shot on the day of the sentencing right in the building of the Supreme Court of Justice.

As Korrespondent.net reported, in February 2017, love for Joseph Stalin in Russia reached its highest level in 16 years. 46% of Russian citizens treat him with "admiration", "respect" and "sympathy".

reviews.author: Êñ∞‰∫ï„ÅÇ„Åö„Åç
reviews.text: From 1934 to 1955, the military division of the Supreme Court was located here, and it was known as the Gun House. Between October 1936 and November 1938 alone, 31,456 people were sentenced to death by firing squad, some of which were carried out in this basement. Relatives were not informed that they had been executed, and lines of people forming for several kilometers were said to have formed to get information about their arrested relatives.

reviews.author: Nik Nov
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the building is not being handed over to the GULAG History Museum. The place where more than 30,000 people were shot, where Tukhachevsky, Blucher, Yegorov, Meyerhold, Vavilov, Korolev, Tupolev were sent to their deaths is being converted into a "premium department store". The cynicism is off the charts

name: Tsar Bell
address: Ivanovskaya Ploshchad', Moskva, 119072

reviews.author: Ross Daniels
reviews.text: It is hard to miss this iconic Kremlin sight because it is the largest bell in the world, standing at 6.14 meters tall and 6.6 meters in diameter and it weighs approximately 201,924 kilograms. So its big. It was commissioned by Empress Anna Ivanovna and cast between 1733 and 1735 by Ivan Motorin and his son Mikhail. But as with the best laid plans of men and mice it cracked during a fire in 1737 and has never been rund. So don't hand around for the ringing ceremony.

reviews.author: Vagabond Couple
reviews.text: The biggest bell in the world, a staggering 219 tons! The Tsar Bell (Tsar-Kolokol) is a massive bell located in front of Ivan the Great Bell Tower in Cathedral Square, Moscow Kremlin. The Tsar Bell was cast in 1735 but was damaged during a fire in 1737. It was later repaired but never used. Today, the bell stands as a monument to Russian craftsmanship and engineering. It is a popular tourist attraction and a symbol of Russian national pride.

reviews.author: Brad
reviews.text:
There are many interesting things to see within the Walls of the Kremlin in central Moscow. One of these is the Tsar Bell, situated in front of the Ivan the Great Bell Tower. This is believed to be the largest bell in the world at over 200,000kg in weight.

The bell was made between 1733-35. It stands at 6.14 metres tall and measures 6.6 in diameter. You can appreciate the scale and size of the Tsar Bell by standing near it for photos and while viewing it from 40+ metres away where you can see how much larger it is than the people posing for pictures in front of this monument. Note, the broken section of the bell. It rests beside the bell and is equally impressive in size.

Note: Another similar large scale item is the enormous Tsar Cannon located not far away on the other side of the Ivan the Great Bell Tower. It is worth having a look-see as well.

reviews.author: Vasilis Kosmidis
reviews.text: Don't miss visiting and taking photos of the largest Bell in the world! Weighting almost 200 tonnes! ü§™ It actually never rang because it was incredibly difficult (of course...) to lift it. The cracked piece was a result of the cold water on it, after it was heated by a fire in the place where it was kept. The fire men head to put out the fire...

reviews.author: CK Cheong
reviews.text: Acknowledged as the heaviest bell known to exist in the world today. The huge Russian Tsar Bell (also known as the Tsar Kolokol III) weighs 216-tons. Currently on display on the grounds of the Moscow Kremlin. The bell was damaged during a fire in 1737, while being cast resulting in a large piece to break off.

name: Abduction of Europa Fountain
address: Square of Europe, 1–ê, Moskva, 121059

reviews.author: Santosh Deval
reviews.text:
The sculpture by Olivier Strebel has become the largest such structure in all of Moscow and is considered the first of its kind in Russia. The fountain has four cascades, it is located in a bowl with a diameter of 50 meters and is illuminated by a thousand LED lights, the height of the central composition is 11 meters.

The sculpture depicts a plot from ancient Greek mythology: Zeus, in love with Europe, the daughter of the Greek king Agenor, came to her in the form of a beautiful bull. The girl began to play with the bull, sat on his back, and the bull took it and ran into the sea, taking the girl with him to the island of Crete, where he married her. The girl bore him sons. The sculptor shows this moment by intertwining metal pipes, in which he depicts the head of a giant bull and a woman in his horns. The fountain has 5 bowls, located one inside the other, which cascade down from the sculpture. There are 48 columns nearby, on which the flags of European countries flutter.

Merkurov, architect I.A. French). This monument differs from the typical and familiar incarnations of the leader: Lenin is depicted sitting and leaning forward, which gives the sculptural image a certain dynamism and creates the impression that Ilyich is listening attentively to his interlocutor. He rests his left hand, holding a book or a notebook, on his knee. His right hand with a pencil is behind the back of the chair.
